review: The Amazon Fire TV Stick has turned my 55' Samsung TV into a smart tv. The hardest thing about installing it was getting at the HDMI port on the TV because it is on a flush mount. Once I got it into a port and hooked up the power set up was very simple. I live in the sticks and have a slow 3mbps DSL connection. It found my WIFI signal with no problem. I have played with it a little bit. Netflix loads with no problems and plays flawlessly. I've also tried Pandora with the same results. I am VERY SATISFIED with this purchase. I have already recommended it to friends. I'm glad I opted for this over the other similar products that are available.
author: T-dub

review: Love the Amazon Fire TV Stick.  It's a bit slower in the response time than the Set Top Box I originally purchased; but, I love the fact that it doesn't require an MDFI cable.  Just plug the Stick into the MDFI on the back of the TV.  Makes it cheaper too as you don't have the expense of the HDMI cable.  I can easily move the Amazon Stick between the kitchen TV and the bedroom TV.  I do have one small gripe about the Fire Stick.  I had to watch a You Tube video to make sure I was trying to open the remote correctly to insert the batteries.  I found it to be just about impossible to open as the fit is so incredibly tight.  I have RA which makes this process even more difficult so it was a study in frustration.  I bet it took at least 10 minutes to accomplish.  Also, the remote is so small, and short, that there is hardly anything to hang on to when you are trying to push the buttons on the bottom row.  I would guess that the small size will also make this remote easy to misplace/lose.  The Fire Stick is still a great product and the remote issues would not prevent me from purchasing a 2nd unit.
